intro: Kochia vestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters, typically in late summer. Kochia vestita is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil quality.
